identity.name: MiroBridge
identity.aesthetic: Swiss International Style meets Modern SaaS

rules: Use Inter for Body text and UI elements
Use JetBrains Mono for data values, IDs, or code snippets

Button.default: inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-lg text-sm font-medium transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50
Button.secondary: bg-white text-slate-900 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 shadow-sm

Card.base: rounded-xl border border-slate-200 bg-white text-slate-950 shadow-[0_2px_4px_rgba(0,0,0,0.02)]

StickyNote.base: aspect-square p-4 shadow-sm rotate-1 hover:rotate-0 transition-transform duration-200 cursor-default flex flex-col justify-center items-center text-center

Frame.base: border-2 border-dashed border-slate-200 bg-slate-50/50 rounded-lg p-4 relative

accessibility.contrast_check: Ensure text over colored backgrounds meets WCAG AA (4.5:1).
accessibility.focus_states: All interactive elements must have visible focus rings.
accessibility.aria_labels: Buttons with icons only must have aria-label.

assets.icons: Use 'lucide-react' for all UI icons. Use thin strokes (1.5px) for elegance.

images.hero_bg: Abstract geometric shapes or a subtle mesh gradient. NO stock photos of people shaking hands.
images.empty_state: Minimalist line art illustration or a simple icon grouping.

instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'Inter' for body text. Add these fonts via Google Fonts in index.html.
Create a 'MiroBoard' component that visually represents the frames and sticky notes using CSS grid and absolute positioning where appropriate, or a flex wrap layout.
Implement the 'StickyNote' component with random slight rotations (-1deg to 1deg) to feel organic.
The 'Generate' button should trigger a visible state change (loading spinner + text update).
Display the generated slides in a 'Carousel' or 'Grid' view before export.
Ensure the 'Speaker Notes' are accessible via a toggle or a detail view in the slide preview.
Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, cards) for testing.
Do NOT use gradients for text. Keep text high-contrast solid colors.
The Preview area should feel distinct from the Input areaâ€”use a subtle background color change (e.g., white vs slate-50).
Strictly follow the color palette. Do not introduce new colors.
universal_guidelines: Do not use generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry where possible.
Create depth through layered design elements.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters for floating controls.
Use generous spacing (p-6, p-8) to avoid clutter.
Ensure all components use named exports.
Never use transparent backgrounds on headers without a blur.
